intro: Scleromitrion leptocaule, commonly known as the slender-stemmed rockrose, is a succulent shrub native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped, white or pink flowers during the cooler months. Its thick, water-storing stems and leaves help it survive in dry environments. It is often found growing on rocky outcrops and is well adapted to low-nutrient soils.
